definition: Alexandr Sergeevich Pushkin (1799-1837), great Russian romantic poet
general/popular/everywhere/universal
to hope/to admire/variant of 稀[xi1]
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: FEW weeks ago my colleague wrote about the difficulties of translating Pushkin.
sentences.chinese: 几星期前，我同事写了写关于翻译普希金的难处。

sentences.english: A FEW weeks ago my colleague wrote about the difficulties of translating Pushkin.

sentences.english: Pushkin is a great poet as well as a brilliant writer of historical works.
sentences.chinese: 普希金是一位伟大的诗人，也是杰出的历史题材作家。

sentences.english: Alexander Sergeyevich Pushkin is a great author who initiated the literature history of Russia.
sentences.chinese: 普希金是俄国文学史上第一位举世瞩目的伟大作家。
